page.title: 16Trade in Featherstone
page.content: The shopping facilities in Featherstone consist of one small main shopping street of about 60 shops and a market on a Thursday of about 30 stalls with general stores situated in the outskirts.With the exeption of stalls specialising in wet fish,eggs and men's jeans all the stalls duplicate the shops.There are two supermarkets and plans have been put forward to build a third.One can buy the whole range of consumer goods but there is no choice with regards to the larger items such as furniture.People in North Featherstone very rarely go into the town prefering to shop for fresh foods at local stores and travel to towns close by for other goods. Those living closer to town do use it more for food but still travel for non food items.The generla opinion being that shopping facilities are poor.
